crazyballrun.game.graphics

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.graphics.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    The Animation class is used to render a series of picture in a given frequency. It offers functionality for rendering (paint-method), creation (initializes the animation with several BufferedImage-instances) and configuration (to set lifetime, position, size, animation timesteps, etc.).

      Checks if the animation is still alive.

      Checks if the animation is dead and should be removed.

      Destroys the animation (remove it from the rendering context by setting lifetime to zero).

      Renders the animation into the given render context (g).

      Sets the time step size for the animation, after how many miliseconds to change picture.
      void setImages(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] images)
      Sets the images of the animation (every image has the same size!).
      void setLifeTime(long lifetime)
      Sets the animation's remaining lifetime in miliseconds.
      void setPlayOnce(boolean once)
      Forces the animation to be played once only.
      void setPosition(Vector2D pos)
      Sets the current position of the animation.
      void setRotation(double rot)
      Sets the current rotation of the animation.

         java.awt.Frame f,

        Parameters:
        c - reference to the camera where to paint the animation
        g - reference to the render context
        f - reference to the frame
        timestep - time passed since the last call (estimation)
